1.content:
Tall grass, big rocks, and towering trees. You are a two inch tall micro wolf named Samuel, but you are often referred to as Sam. Recently, your favorite berry bush has been raided by a flock of birds, and you need to find a new source of food. You travel west, opposite of the bush. The grass here is in patches, so you must be careful not to get too exposed. Dashing patch to patch, you start to get the feeling that you’re lost. Nevertheless , you press on.
After about an hour or so of exploring, you find yourself in an unfamiliar area. Still foodless, you continue your search, even farther away from the known.
Just then, you see a huge wall in the distance. It appears to be what you have heard before as a fence, but you’ve never seen one. When you were little, your mother told you stories about huge creatures that looked like us, but they were tall enough to touch the leaves of trees! These hundreds of feet tall creatures were rarely friendly, and often used micros as foot slaves, sex toys, and even snacks. But they were just stories, not real or anything... were they? You, like many micros, live life inside of trees and under rocks, and rarely come across these “giants”. Micros often congregate and socialize, so maybe macros are the same! You can’t take it. You pick up your pace and curiosity takes over. About ten minutes later, you arrive at the base of the fence. You feel a shiver go down your spine, and you get ready to make the decision.
1.title: Curiosity...

You look at the dirt covered fence and smile. There is something inside you that is longing to know the unknown. You make your way to bottom of the fence and crawl underneath the partially rotten wood. You immediately notice the grass on this side is a lot thicker than the forest grass. Seeing that the grass can support your weight, you step up atop the large green blades.
The view in front of you is startling, yet exciting. In front of you was a long yard, leading to the biggest structures you have ever seen. The house it lead to has a white exterior, as well as a concrete porch. The doors that make up the entrance are glass. You run with haste toward the house, excited to experience such a sight.

********

Every wall of the house touched the sky. Each room was bigger than any tree you ran around before. This place seems like one of magic!
You feel a strange yet sudden sense of vulnerability. If this was a creature’s house, then the creature living here must be huge! Thankfully, no one seems to be here. Catching sight of a door, you make your way toward it.

In an action that was more instinct than reason, you immediately throw your hands up and shout, “Wait! Stop! Don’t hurt me! I’m just a little wolf!”

The wolf’s face falls into bewilderment, “You... you talk...” She slowly lowers her paw, witch was by her knee.

“Yes!” You shout.
Her massive body descends as she plants her knees on the floor and sits on her legs.

“Oh my gosh, you are a wolf! But, you’re so tiny, I guess you are one of those ‘micro’ fellas, aren’t you...” she lifts her finger and moves it toward you. You slowly back up, and trip over your own paws out of clumsiness. You fall on your rear.

“Oh my. I’m sorry! I didn’t mean to scare you!” She quickly apologies, “ Let me pick you up and put you on my desk. I don’t want my boyfriend to step on you, silly.”
She cups her hand around your feet, and you instinctively pull your feet up and onto her furry hand. She lifts you up gently, and begins walking. When she is over there desk, she carefully parts her hands, allowing you to slide in between them. She sits in a chair and pulls herself forward to the desk.

“My, it’s been so long since I’ve seen a micro up close. I hardly ever see them, and when I do, Jerry is eating them, toying with them.” Though her face was rather nonchalant, your face was put in shock.

They DO torture your kind!

“H-huh-who’s Jerry?” You ask timidly.

“My boyfriend.”

This monster lives here? “What?”

She notices your sudden fear, and quickly comforts you, “aww... don’t worry! I promise that I will make sure you won’t get eaten or become his toy. If he wants you, he will have to get through me!” She winks.

You smile. “Excuse me, but I never caught her name.”

“I’m Callie. Do you... micros...have a name?”

“Yeah, I’m Samuel, or Sam. Why wouldn’t I have a name?”

“Well,” She starts, “I never really thought of micros being this... intelligent.”

You turn and cross your arms. “Hmph!” You scoff.

“Aww, I didn’t mean it that way. I guess I never really thought that you or any other of your kind would have... complex emotions, or any kind of self awareness. Could you forgive me?” She looks at you kindly.

“It’s ok, I don’t hold anything against you. You just didn’t know. And honestly, I thought your kind just had my kind around to eat, or for entertainment.”

“Thanks. Hey, I have to cook dinner. Can you behave while I’m away?”

You feel that Callie is a trustworthy furson and living with her would benefit you greatly, both in social aspects and in physical aspects. She is sheltering you, protecting you from danger, and feeding you. So, you decide to stay.

Weird...

You stare in awe and terror at the huge male fox as he enters the room and shuffles paper on his desk. He is an orange and white fox with green eyes, and is wearing beige khakis and white socks. He is mildly built, but not muscular. His black, digitigrade footpaw claws stick out of his sock.
You see him smile, “Ahh, here it is!” He picks up a sheet of paper and steps out of the room.

You stand in shock. Never have you seen such a massive creature! You suddenly realize that you are completely out in the open. You look around and notice a shelf like structure with a gap between the floor and the bottom shelf. The gap is slightly taller than you are, and it is rather dark. You quickly run towards the shelf and hope that the fox does not come back.
Luckily, you scurry under the shelf with ease, and the fox is still nowhere to be found. While you glance out from under the shelf, you hear a voice from behind you!
“H-h-huh-who are you?” Say a shaky male voice.
You twist around and see another micro. He is a gryphon, with lion legs and stomach, and brown feathers and yellow talon arms. His ribs are freakishly visible, and his feathers are fading. He looks as if he is actually starving!
“I’m Samuel. Are you alright?” You extend your paw and start walking towards him slowly.
“I haven’t eaten anything in two weeks. It hurts to run.”
“How do you survive?!” The fact that he is alive is astonishing.
“I drink whatever water drips from the back of the shelf. He waters his flowers on the top shelf every few days, and a few drops of water runs down the back of the shelf. As for eating, I don’t.” He wobbles a bit. “Two weeks ago, I ate a piece of mulch that ran down with the water. I... I ...” He nearly collapses on the floor, but you quickly catch him.
“I got you, sit down, your okay.” You comfort him and guide him to the floor. “What’s your name?”
“I... I’m Sheen.”
“Well don’t worry Sheen, I find you something to eat.”
He smiles, “Thank you! Oh my god, you have no idea how happy I am! There’s food on the counter, but I can’t climb. Not like this. Look out for Tom, you know, the big fox.”
“Alright, I will. Stay here and rest.”

You can see the kitchen. It’s in the next room. But is sheen really that much of a priority?

As you back up, you notice that she has her legs are parted just enough for you to walk through. You realize that if you decide to go exploring that way, you are not likely to live.
11423323.title: To the foot of the bed

114233232.content:
You think to yourself, I’ve gone this far, so why not live a little more! Ignoring “living a little more”, you understand that what you are doing is dangerous. You accept the risk, and begin walking towards the hallway with cloth roof and fur walls. As soon as you pass her paws, you can feel the heat radiating from her legs, warming up the air and you. There is very little room to walk. You can reach out your arms and touch her legs on either side of you. You shiver to think that what would seem like an insignificant action to this beast could easily kill you. You continue walking and pass her knees a second time. As you approach her thighs, you notice how tall they are, as well as how the fat distributes itself. The fat is creating a tunnel that you could crawl trough, but you should probably walk. Her thighs force you into a triangular path, with her thigh fat closing in to form a point.
‘Hmm...’ you think to yourself, ‘I wonder if I could...’ you slide your handpaws into the crevice of fat and try to separate it. ‘Grrrrraah! Damn. Didn’t even budge.’

Looks like you are crawling.

You drop to your stomach and start to crawl. As you crawl, you constantly rub your back on the furry roof. It’s dark, cramped, and there is an interesting smell that you can’t put your finger on. Finally, you come to a fur wall that has a tunnel leading up, and a tight tunnel at its base. Yup, you are at her groin. It appears that there are two choices.
114233232.title: I’ve gone this far. Lets go a little more.

1142332322.content:
You decide to take the path below her ass. You get down on your knees and push yourself into the cave made by her gargantuan butt cheeks. It’s a tight fit, but you are able to wiggle further inside. The heat is incredible, as you feel it radiating off her cheeks, and in turn make you hot. The friction of her fur against yours was not very comfortable either.

The smell of her ass grows stronger. You assume that you are in pretty deep, and realize you should get out. But, before you could leave, the fluffy walls around you began to quake! You feel her butt crack pull apart, and before you know it, they come back together and pull you up between them. You are now suspended between her butt cheeks, unable to move or breathe. You struggle to move, but tire quickly. Slowly, you run out of... air ... and... then...

You suffocated between a bears butt cheeks.
